intro: Orophea katschallica, commonly known as the Katschala torchwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble torches. The plant features palmate leaves with a waxy texture and produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
